description: Default light color for WCAG 2.0.
Calculate the relative luminance for a color.

context.name: k-color-luminance

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The color to calculate the relative luminance for.

return.description: The relative luminance for the color.

usedBy.description: Calculates contrast ratio between two colors
Calculates contrast ratio between two colors
Checks if a color is dark
Checks if a color is light

description: Calculates contrast ratio between two colors

return.description: The contrast ratio between the two colors

usedBy.description:
Calculates the contrast ratio between a background color and a foreground color.
If the contrast ratio is not high enough, it will return the color with the highest contrast ratio.

context.name: k-contrast-color

description: Checks if a color is dark

return.description: True if the color is dark, false otherwise

description: Checks if a color is light

return.description: True if the color is light, false otherwise

description:
Calculates the contrast ratio between a background color and a foreground color.
If the contrast ratio is not high enough, it will return the color with the highest contrast ratio.

context.name: k-contrast-color

parameter.name: dark
parameter.description: The dark color to use as a fallback

parameter.name: light
parameter.description: The light color to use as a fallback

parameter.name: min-ratio
parameter.description: The minimum contrast ratio to reach

return.description: The color with the highest contrast ratio

usedBy.description: Generates all color variations of a given main color

context.name: k-generate-color-variations

description:
The color white.
Note: you cannot change this value.

The color black.
Note: you cannot change this value.

The color transparent.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from transparent to black.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from transparent to white.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from black to transparent.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that goes from white to transparent.
Note: you cannot change this value.

A gradient that cycles through the colors of the rainbow.
Note: you cannot change this value.
Generates all color variations of a given main color

context.name: k-generate-color-variations

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the main color

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The color value to be assigned to the main color

parameter.name: theme
parameter.description: The theme the colors will be generated for

return.description: A map with the generated keys and values

description:
Takes a color name from the $kendo-colors map as a parameter
and returns a CSS variable with the actual color as a fallback

context.name: k-color

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: The name of a color/key in the $kendo-colors map

return.description: CSS variable with the actual color as a fallback

throw: Color Variable \`#{$key}\` does not exists in the color collection.

description: The global default Colors map.

The global default Elevation map.
The Gray Palette provides colors to the Base, Secondary, Light, Dark, and Inverse variable groups.
The Coral Palette provides colors to the Primary and Series A variable groups.
The Sky Blue Palette provides colors to the Tertiary variable group.
The Green Palette provides colors to the Success variable group.
The Blue Palette provides colors to the Info variable group.
The Yellow Palette provides colors to the Warning variable group.
The Red Palette provides colors to the Error variable group.
The Lemon Yellow Palette provides colors to the Series B variable group.
The Spring Green Palette provides colors to the Series C variable group.
The Royal Blue Palette provides colors to the Series D variable group.
The Lavender Purple Palette provides colors to the Series E variable group.
The Flamingo Pink Palette provides colors to the Series F variable group.

description: Returns whether `$list` is bracketed.
Joins two lists together.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.description: The separator to use between `$list1` and `$list2`.

parameter.name: bracketed
parameter.description: Whether the result should be bracketed.

example.code:
@debug k-list-join( ( "foo", "bar" ), ( "baz", "qux" ) ); // => "foo, bar, baz, qux"
@debug k-list-join( ( "foo", "bar" ), ( "baz", "qux" ), " " ); // => "foo bar baz qux"

description:
Restricts `$number` to the range between `$min` and `$max`. If `$number` is
less than `$min`, `$min` is returned. If `$number` is greater than `$max`,
`$max` is returned. Otherwise, `$number` is returned.
